name: Main Building
description: Shaped like a three-point star with a rectangle in its south; the main academic building of the campus, containing most of the lecture and laboratory rooms and offices
location: Near the flagpole and freedom park; beside the lagoon

name: Amphitheater
description: An area where students can gather, eat, and hold small gatherings such as meetings, jammings, etc.
location: Inside Lagoon, near Non-Food Stalls Building

name: Campus Development Building
description: A building where campus development initiatives and maintenance services are planned and organized
location: Behind East Wing, near Nutrition and Food Science Building

name: Charlie Del Rosario Hall
description: A Freedom Hall Building, established in honor of late Charlie Del Rosario, a former student leader in PUP, which serves as a venue for various events and activities such as seminars, workshops, and other events
location: Near canteen and Linear Park

name: Dome
description: The circular offices at the center of the main building where faculty of some colleges are staying
location: Center of the main building, each floor

name: East Wing
description: The east wing of the main building
location: Main building

name: Engineering Science Research Center (ESRC) Building
description: New building in front of gymnasium near the gate
location: In front of gymnasium near the gate

name: Flagpole
description: Under construction
location: Near Obelisk

name: Grandstand
description: A wide area where students can gather for events and activities such as flag ceremonies, concerts, and other events
location: East part of the Track and Field Oval from the entrance near the main gate

name: Guard House
description: A security post where the security guards are stationed to monitor the entrance and exit of the campus
location: West part of the main gate

name: Gymnasium and Sports Center
description: A hall where students train physically and a training ground for the student athletes that participate in the intercollegiate sports program
location: In front of ESRC building; west part of the entrance

name: Interfaith Chapel
description: A sacred space designed to provide a welcoming environment for people of all faiths and beliefs to come together for prayer, reflection, and meditation, fostering spiritual growth, understanding, and respect for diversity
location: Near East Wing and Nutrition and Food Science Building

name: Laboratory High School
description: A high school building where the laboratory high school students are studying and having their classes
location: Near NALLRC and beside

name: Lagoon
description: A wide area surrounding a lagoon where students can hang out and eat because most food stalls are located here
location: Near Amphitheater, its entrance near Obelisk

name: Linear Park
description: A straight path park near the Pasig River where students can hang out and eat
location: Near canteen and Charlie Del Rosario Building

name: Mabini Monument PUP Obelisk
description: A monument of the Philippine hero Apolinario Mabini and the PUP Obelisk that symbolizes the university's mission and vision
location: Along University Avenue at the center, before entrance to Lagoon

name: Nemesio E. Prudente Freedom Park
description: Under construction
location: Near flagpole and North Wing of the Main Building

name: Ninoy Aquino Library
description: A studying area and arena of books available for students
location: Near Charlie Del Rosario Building and Laboratory High School

name: Non-Food Stalls Building
description: An area where students can buy school supplies, photocopying services, and other services
location: Beside NALLRC and near the end of Lagoon

name: North Parking Area
description: A parking area for students, faculty, staff, and visitors
location: Near Physical Education Building and Lagoon

name: North Wing
description: Under construction
location: Main building

name: Nutrition and Food Science Building
description: A building where students of Nutrition and Food Science are studying and having their classes
location: Near Interfaith Chapel and East Wing

name: Open Court
description: Under construction
location: Beside University Avenue and near Gymnasium

name: Physical Education Building
description: A building where PE students are conducting classes and faculty of College of Human Kinetics are staying
location: Near North Parking Area and Tahanan ng Alumni

name: Printing Press Building
description: A building for university printing services
location: Near Property and Supply Building, behind Laboratory High School

name: PUP Sta Mesa Ferry Station
description: A ferry station where people can ride a ferry boat to cross the Pasig River
location: Behind South Wing and beside Pasig River

name: Pylon
description: The entrance of the campus where the three-block rectangular structure is located
location: Main gate

name: R.C. Overhead Water Tank
description: A water tank that supplies water to the campus
location: In front of NALLRC

name: Sampaguita Building
description: Also formerly known as the University Canteen located at the northern right of Main Building, West Wing
location: Beside linear park and near the canteen

name: South Wing
description: The south wing of the main building
location: Main building

name: Souvenir Shop
description: A shop where PUPians can buy campus merchandise such as shirts, lanyards, mugs, etc.
location: Along University Avenue and beside Bahay ni Mabini

name: Student Canteen
description: An eating area near the Linear Park
location: Beside Sampaguita Building

name: Swimming Pool
description: An olympic-sized swimming pool that is capable of handling several swimming classes and student athlete activities simultaneously
location: Beside Gymnasium (right) and Tahanan ng Alumni (left)

name: Tahanan ng Alumni
description: A building where alumni can stay and have their meetings and gatherings
location: Beside Swimming Pool (right) and Physical Education Building (left)

name: Tahanan ng Atleta
description: A building where student athletes can stay and have their meetings and gatherings
location: West part of Track and Field Oval from Oval North Entrance

name: Tennis Court
description: A court where students can play tennis
location: Beside University Avenue and Open Court, near Gymnasium

name: Track and Field Oval
description: A big grass area that can serve as softball, soccer, football, and running fields for students
location: West part of the University Avenue; North Entrance near Guard House

name: Visitors Information Center
description: A center where visitors can ask for directions and information about the university
location: Near main gate, seen right after entering campus (left)

name: West Wing
description: The west wing of the main building
location: Main building
